FuncDef: The display security risk command displays security risks in the system and suggested solutions for the risks. The display security risk command displays security risks in the system and suggested solutions for the risks.
CLIs: display security risk [ [ feature <feature-name> ] | [ level <level-para> ] | [ type <type-para> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays security risks of a specified feature.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Displays security risks of High, Medium, or Low level.
Security risk level. It can be any value of the following:
highmediumlow

Displays security risks of a specified type.
Security risk type. It can be any value of the following:
insecure-algorithminsecure-protocolinsecure-configuration

ExtraInfo:
Some protocols used by users may have security risks due to different security performance of protocols.
In this case, you can run this command to check security risks in the system and eliminate the risks according to the provided suggestions. For example, if SNMPv1 is configured, the system displays a message indicating that SNMPv3 is recommended because SNMPv1 has security risks.
